clinical_study.brief_title: NATURE 3.2_New Approach for the Reduction of REnal Uremic Toxins
clinical_study.official_title: XUANRO4 - NATURE 3.2 - Nuovo Approccio Per la Riduzione Delle Tossine Uremiche Renali, REGIONE PUGLIA - FSC 2007-2013 Ricerca. Intervento "Cluster Tecnologici Regionali"

collaborator.agency: Universit√† degli Studi di Bari Aldo Moro

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of the pilot study is to validate a combined approach based on the use of an innovative symbiotic and an innovative dialysis cartridge in patients on hemodialysis (HD).
The symbiotic consists of a mixture of probiotics (Lactobacilli and Bifidobacteria), prebiotics (fructoligosaccharides and inulin) and natural antioxidants (a mix of quercetin, resveratrol and proanthocyanidins).
The cartridge is composed of a divinylbenzene (DVB) adsorbing resine, expected to have high affinity to protein-bound uremic toxins pCS and IS, on the basis of its chemical structure.
This combined approach will be aimed at achieving two main objectives:
1. reduction of blood levels of microbial-derived uremic toxins, involved in cardiovascular complications
2. reduction of inflammation markers and oxidative stress and reduction of intestinal permeability

primary_outcome.measure: Change of serum concentration of pCS
primary_outcome.description: Change of p-cresyl sulfate (pCS) serum concentrations assessed by liquid chromatography/mass spectrometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of serum concentration of IS
secondary_outcome.description: Change of indoxyl sulfate (IS) serum concentrations assessed by liquid chromatography/mass spectrometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of serum concentration of D-lactate
Change of serum concentration of LPS
Change of serum concentration of inflammatory markers
secondary_outcome.description: Change of interleukin (IL)IL10, IL17, pentraxin3 (PTX3) serum concentrations (pg/ml) evaluated by ELISA

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of serum concentration of NO
secondary_outcome.description: Change of nitric oxide (NO) serum concentration (uM) evaluated by spectrometry

other_outcome.description: Change of the relative abundance (%) of Operational Taxonomic Units (OTUs) of Firmicutes, Bacteroidetes,Proteobacteria, Verrucomicrobia, Actinobacteria, Synergistetes, Cyanobacteria, Euryarchaeota, Chloroflexi, Nitrospirae, Tenericutes, Fusobacteria, Thermotogae, Acidobacteria evaluated by fecal bacterial DNA genome sequencing.
Change of gastrointestinal symptoms evaluated by Gastrointestinal Symptoms Rating Scale (GSRS) questionnaire (15 items scored 1-7 each, 1 representing the best and 7 the worse outcome for each item)
Change of stool type evaluated by BRISTOL Stool Scale (range 1-7, lower and higher values representing worse outcome, middle values representing better outcome)

other_outcome.measure: Change of serum concentration of TMAO
other_outcome.description: Change of trimethylamine-N-oxide (TMAO) serum concentrations assessed by liquid chromatography/mass spectrometry

arm_group.description: HD patients with 7 weeks symbiotic administration + 1 week overlapping with the 3 dialytic sessions with the DVB cartridge
HD patients with 7 weeks placebo administration + 1 week overlapping with the 3 dialytic sessions with the DVB cartridge

intervention.description: HD patients follow a 8-weeks oral administration of the symbiotic supplement (2 bags/day)
HD patients follow a 8-weeks oral administration of the placebo (2 bags/day)
On the last week of the symbiotic/placebo period, patients undergo 3 dialytic sessions with the DVB cartridge

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- CKD patients on bicarbonate hemodialysis
- Aged between 30 to 65
- BMI between 18.5 and 29.9
- Omnivore diet
- Informed consent signed
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of antibiotics or probiotics up to 30 days prior to recruitment
- Chronic gastrointestinal disorders
- Systemic inflammatory diseases
- Suspicion or clinical diagnosis of malignancy
- Chronic liver disease
- Treatment with corticosteroids or immunosuppressive drugs
- Psychiatric conditions reducing the compliance to treatment protocols

overall_official.affiliation: Nephrology, Dialysis and Transplantation Unit "Aldo Moro" University of Bari
